tabs.header_iregular:
Earache can be very painful. Let's do something.

The first thing to do is get a warm moist cloth and apply over the ear that hurt. 

When you have done that, see available over the counter earache medications below.

We will use this information to make a good decision on how to take care of this earache you are experiencing.
tabs.header:
Earache could be caused by different things, which of these listed below apply to you?

Choose your symptoms from the list below and see what is recommended.
fieldset: Earache is as a result or cold or allergy.
I suspect a ruptured ear drum
Started after a toothache
A result of water in the ear.
Ear is swollen inside or outside
Ear canal is itching and getting painful.
I also have fever
I also have a sore throat
Like pressure/fluid in the ear. Yawning or coughing cannot get rid of it.
Fluid is also draining from the ear.
Prevention only
None of these

mode.1:
None of these?
We must have left something out.
mode.2: Something to prevent?
mode.3: Ruptured ear drum? You should go to the nearest urgent care or emergency room.
mode.4:
All of these?
You must have this earache really bad.
mode.5: Selection require a pain reliever.
mode.6: Selection require soothing ear drops.
mode.7: Selection require a decongestant.
mode.8: Selection require a warm compress.
mode.9: Selection require you to seek urgent care.

mode.11: Symptoms require a pain reliever and a decongestant

mode.13: Symptoms require a pain reliever and you should seek urgent care.

collapsable.title: Pain relievers click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
NSAIDs

You will start with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs

 if you can take something like ibuprofen or naproxen which are good examples.

This would help with any swelling that is typical of earaches and ear pain. Most of the time, an inflammation is causing the ear pain.

Acetaminophen

This is the second choice if you cannot take ibuprofen or naproxen.

collapsable.title: Hemoepathic eardrops click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
Hylands, Similasan or store brands.

These eardrops should temporarily relieve ear pain and congestion or at a minimum soothe the ear.

We recommend you add an oral anti-inflammatory pain reliever to this if you want  to sleep at night.

collapsable.title: Warming soothing oils click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
Olive/sweet oil, mullein/garlic oil, tea tree oil.

Use any of these if the ear is not draining pus. 

We recommend starting with sweet oil or olive oil. Don't go looking for sweet oil at the pharmacy. Get olive oil, warm it up and put 2 to 3 drops in the affected ear(s). Make sure you heat the olive oil by putting it in a container and putting the container in hot water or running it under hot water. Test the temperature on the forearm and apply the drops.

Warning. Stay away from these if an earache is caused by swimming or water in the ear. It will make it worse. The oil will just be floating on the water. You will need drying agents for this situation.

collapsable.title: "Preventive measures click to collapse contents"
Pain Reliever click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
NSAIDs

You will start with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs if you can take something like ibuprofen or naproxen which are good examples.

This would help with any swelling which is typical of earaches and ear pain. Most of the time, an inflammation is causing the ear pain.

Acetaminophen

This is the second choice if you cannot take ibuprofen or naproxen.

collapsable.title: Soothing ear drops click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
Olive/sweet oil, mullein/garlic oil, tea tree oil.

Use any of these if the ear is not draining pus. We recommend starting with sweet oil or olive oil. Don't go looking for sweet oil at the pharmacy. Get olive oil, warm it up and put 2 to 3 drops in the affected ear(s). Make sure you heat the olive oil by putting it in a container and putting the container in hot water or running it under hot water. Test the temperature on the forearm and apply the drops.

Warning. Stay away from these if an earache is caused by swimming or water in the ear. It will make it worse. The oil will just be floating on the water. You will need drying agents for this situation.

Hylands, Similasan or store brands.

These eardrops should temporarily relieve ear pain and congestion or at a minimum soothe the ear.

We recommend you add an oral anti-inflammatory pain reliever to this if you want  to sleep at night.

collapsable.title: Decongestants click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
This will be useful if an earache is due to sinus pain and pressure or resulted from a cold or allergy.

Get pseudoephedrine. Ask for this at the pharmacy counter.

collapsable.title: Warm Compress click to expand contents
collapsable.content: This should help with the inflammatory pain and ease congestion in the affected ear.

collapsable.title: Urgent Care Clinic click to expand contents
collapsable.content: Please go to the nearest urgent care clinic. Nothing over-the-counter will take care of this.

collapsable.title: Worth doing click to expand contents

irregular.content: Let's use this information to choose a good over-the -counter remedy.

collapsable.content:
• Recommendation is the opinion of a registered US Pharmacist currently practicing as a community pharmacist.
  • Recommendation is not an attempt to discuss all possible self care or treatment approach to this health challenge.
  • The responsibility of the recommending pharmacist is limited to this question:
    "If a patient presents with these symptoms, what will you recommend and why?"
    It is not an attempt to publish an article on the treatment of any condition. Just what would you tell a patient who present with so and so in the usual course of your practice.
  • The pharmacist image presented in this article may or may not be the actual image of the authoring pharmacist.
    Because we insist on using articles written by currently practicing community pharmacists, these pharmacists may choose to remain anonymous especially if they are employed by an employer to avoid being pressured to recommend a particular product to drive sales.

What if you are currently experiencing the conditions listed below?

Or if you have a question for the pharmacist?

collapsable.title: You have a question click to expand contents
collapsable.content: Please contact the pharmacist. He or she will gladly answer your questions.

collapsable.title: Contacting the pharmacist click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
You may have to unlock the contact form using social networking tools (facebook, twitter, google+, linkedIn) we have made available to you.

If you can't do this, you will have to wait a few seconds depending on the number of users at the time.

collapsable.title: What to expect click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
Expect a reply as soon as possible.
If the authoring pharmacist cannot reply within 24 hours, the system will push your email to the rest of the team. Any available pharmacist will answer your question as soon as possible.

If you have a comment and not a question, please post it in the comments section for all to read.

collapsable.title: What can't be done: click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
No replies to vulgar, disrespectful emails.
The system is programmed to look for certain words that are disrespectful and will automatically delete such emails. They don't get to the pharmacist. This will blacklist your email address automatically.

Email addresses or questions are not saved.
They are deleted once answered and not stored in a database. Should you need to follow up, copy the previous question(s) along with the new message for quick reference.

The pharmacist does not reply to emails that are not relevant to the topic he or she authored. They are forwarded to the author of the topic and are under no obligation to reply.

We encourage pharmacists to respond to questions but are under no obligations to answer questions.

tabs.header_iregular:
Swimmer's ear is an infection. You will have to see a doctor.

The goal of taking care of swimmer's ear infection is to:

  • clear the ear canal of accumulated debris,
  • make the infection go away usually with antibiotics,
  • reduce the inflammation,
  • take some pain relievers and
  • keep the ear canal dry. 

No antibiotics or ear drops for inflammation over-the-counter

And removal of the debris is to be done by a healthcare professional.

The only thing you can do that is available over-the-counter until you can see a doctor are listed below.

We can use these to work out a relief for this swimmer's ear infection.
tabs.header:
Which of the symptoms listed below are you experiencing right now?

Choose your symptoms from the list below and see what is recommended.
fieldset: I think I am looking at a ruptured eardrum.
Pus is draining from the ear.
Ear is getting painful.
Fluid or water in my ear.
Ear appear red and swollen.
I also have fever
Hearing is muffled and reduced.
Ear canal is very itchy.
Prevention only
None of these

mode.1:
None of these?
We must have left something out.

Please choose what you think closely relates to what you are experiencing and see what is recommended.
mode.2: Something to prevent?
mode.3:
All of these?
You must have this swimear really bad.
mode.4:
Ruptured eardrum?
You should seek the nearest urgent care or go to the emergency room.

You should take the child to the nearest children's urgent care clinic.

collapsable.title: Drying ear drops click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
To keep the ear canal dry. 

These ear drops evaporate excess water in the ear and prevent the growth of bacteria and fungi in the ear canal. A mixture of half rubbing alcohol and half white vinegar should do the trick.

We recommend buying ear drops for swimmer's ear over-the-counter. These have other things mixed with them like boric acid.

Be sure to do this only if the eardrum is not ruptured or you don't use any ear tubes.

collapsable.title: Pain relievers click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
Naproxen, ibuprofen for ear pain and inflammation.

 These are anti-inflammatory pain relievers that will be useful in case of any swelling or preventing swelling in the ear canal.

collapsable.title: Antihistamine click to expand contents
collapsable.content: To reduce itching in the ear canal. Take an antihistamine if the ear is very itchy.

collapsable.title: Preventive measures click to collapse contents
collapsable.content:
1. Get in the habit of using a drying ear drop after swimming.

2. A blow dryer set on low is helpful to dry out water after swimming.

collapsable.title: Ear Drops click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
To keep the ear canal dry. 

These ear drops evaporate excess water in the ear and prevent the growth of bacteria and fungi in the ear canal. A mixture of half rubbing alcohol and half white vinegar should do the trick.

We recommend buying ear drops for swimmer's ear over-the-counter. These have other things mixed with them like boric acid.

Be sure to do this only if the eardrum is not ruptured or your child does not use ear tubes.

collapsable.title: Pain Reliever click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
Naproxen, ibuprofen for ear pain and inflammation.

 These are anti-inflammatory pain relievers that will be useful in case of any swelling or preventing swelling in the ear canal.

collapsable.title: Antihistamine click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
To reduce itching in the ear canal. 

Take an antihistamine if the ear is very itchy.

collapsable.title: Warm Compress click to expand contents
collapsable.content: A warm compress should provide temporary relief from the pain and inflammation.

collapsable.title: Seek Urgent Care click to expand contents
collapsable.content: You should go the nearest urgent care clinic for this. It is going to get worse.

collapsable.title: Worth doing click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
1. Get in the habit of using a drying ear drop after swimming.

2. A blow dryer set on low is helpful to dry out water after swimming.

tabs.header_iregular:
Let's see what is available over-the-counter to get rid of ear wax.

Before getting rid of ear wax yourself, you must make sure you do not have a perforated (punctured) eardrum.

This can lead to middle ear infection.

If you are not sure, then seek doctor visit to get rid of the ear wax.

The goal of over-the-counter ear wax removal drops is to gradually soften the wax allowing you to flush it out with a bulb of water.

Let's take a look at what can achieve this objective by answering a few questions.
tabs.header:
Are you looking for a one time process of removing ear wax?

May be you just want to get it over with.
Know this about the safe and effective use of this recommendation.

tabs.header_iregular:
Motion sickness is better prevented than treated. Let's see how we can help.

Over-the-counter motion sickness medications are usually antihistamines.

Some will cause drowsiness. So we have to figure out what will work best for your situation.

Let's take a look at  available over-the-counter medications or options for motion sickness.

collapsable.title: Antihistamines click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
This is the main medication available over-the-counter to help with motion sickness.

Examples are meclizine, dimenhydrinate and diphenhydramine. The non-sedating antihistamines are not effective for motion sickness. So stay away from loratadine, cetirizine or fexofenadine.

Choose meclizine if drowsiness is a concern for you. It is the least drowsy of the group.

collapsable.title: Acupressure / Magnets click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
These are knitted elasticated wrist band, which operates by applying pressure on the Nei Kuan acupressure point on each wrist by means of a plastic stud. A good example is sea band.    ​

Follow the package directions to be sure they work properly and use on both wrists is highly recommended for adequate effect.

collapsable.title: Ginger Gum click to expand contents
collapsable.content:
Ginger gum will help with the nausea of motion sickness for some people. It is worth trying.

Look for a product that will provide 25 mg of ginger oil or 8 g of fresh ginger root per gum.

irregular.content: Last updated by pharmacist on : 02/16/2016 at 10:50:am
